definitions.definition: from one side to the other side of something

examples.text: I drew a line across the page.
A grin spread across her face.
Where's the nearest bridge across the river?

definitions.definition: on the other side of something

examples.text: There's a bank right across the street.

definitions.definition: on or over a part of the body

examples.text: He hit him across the face.
It's too tight across the back.

definitions.definition: in every part of a place, group of people, etc.

examples.text: Her family is scattered across the country.
This view is common across all sections of the community.

definitions.definition: knowing a lot about something; covering or in control of something

examples.text: We need somebody who is across all the issues.
Radio 8 will be across events as they unfold.
